newsitem.title: USA: Quarterdeck Corp faces investor suit.
newsitem.headline: Quarterdeck Corp faces investor suit.

text.p: Investors in Quarterdeck Corp filed a class action suit in California alleging the company concealed facts about its finacial health and inflated stock prices, plaintiffs' lawyers said on Monday.
The lawyers said they sought to recover damages in the case, but did not specify a dollar amount.
The suit was filed by investors who bought Quarterdeck common stock from January 26, 1996, through June 13, 1996, the lawyers said in a statement.
The complaint charges that the computer software company and a former and current executive misrepresented facts "concerning the company's business, financial statements and earnings growth."
Specifically, the complaint alleges the company improperly reported revenues on contingent and consignment deals, causing the company's reported revenues to be artificially inflated.
No one was immediately available at Quarterdeck to comment on the case.
